text: He presents with a sore throat and mild fever. Diagnosed with viral pharyngitis. Advised rest and hydration. Prescribed acetaminophen for fever.
She complains of severe headache and dizziness. MRI shows no abnormalities. Suspected migraine. Prescribed sumatriptan. Advised to avoid triggers.
He reports persistent cough and shortness of breath. Chest X-ray indicates bronchitis. Prescribed antibiotics and a bronchodilator. Follow-up in one week.
She has been experiencing lower back pain for two weeks. X-ray normal. Suspected muscular strain. Recommended physical therapy and NSAIDs.
He presents with rash and itching on arms and legs. Diagnosed with allergic dermatitis. Prescribed antihistamines and topical corticosteroids.
She reports chest pain and palpitations. ECG and blood tests normal. Diagnosed with anxiety. Referred to a psychologist for further evaluation.
He has had intermittent abdominal pain and nausea. Ultrasound reveals gallstones. Referred to a surgeon for possible cholecystectomy.
She presents with frequent urination and excessive thirst. Blood glucose test confirms diabetes mellitus. Started on metformin. Dietary counseling provided.
He complains of joint pain and stiffness, especially in the morning. Suspected rheumatoid arthritis. Referred to a rheumatologist. Blood tests ordered.
She reports difficulty sleeping and constant fatigue. Diagnosed with insomnia. Advised sleep hygiene measures and prescribed zolpidem.
He presents with ear pain and hearing loss. Otoscopy shows otitis media. Prescribed amoxicillin. Advised to avoid water in the ears until resolved.
She complains of blurred vision and headaches. Eye examination reveals glaucoma. Referred to an ophthalmologist. Prescribed eye drops.
He reports persistent runny nose and sneezing. Diagnosed with allergic rhinitis. Prescribed nasal corticosteroids and advised to avoid allergens.
She presents with swelling and pain in the knee. MRI shows meniscus tear. Referred to an orthopedic surgeon. Advised rest and ice application.
He has been experiencing frequent heartburn and regurgitation. Diagnosed with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Prescribed omeprazole. Advised dietary modifications.
She reports feeling sad and losing interest in daily activities. Diagnosed with depression. Started on sertraline. Referred to a therapist for counseling.
He presents with fever, chills, and body aches. Diagnosed with influenza. Prescribed oseltamivir. Advised rest, fluids, and isolation to prevent spread.
She complains of frequent nosebleeds. Blood tests show low platelet count. Referred to a hematologist for further investigation. Advised to avoid nasal trauma.
He reports numbness and tingling in hands and feet. Suspected peripheral neuropathy. Blood tests ordered. Referred to a neurologist for further evaluation.
She presents with unexplained weight loss and fatigue. Blood tests reveal hyperthyroidism. Referred to an endocrinologist. Prescribed methimazole.
He reports chronic stomach pain and bloating. Diagnosed with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). Prescribed dietary modifications and stress management techniques.
She presents with itchy eyes and sneezing. Diagnosed with seasonal allergies. Prescribed antihistamines and advised to monitor pollen counts.
He complains of chest tightness and wheezing. Spirometry shows airflow obstruction. Diagnosed with asthma. Prescribed a bronchodilator and inhaled corticosteroids.
She reports abdominal cramping and diarrhea. Stool tests confirm gastrointestinal infection. Prescribed antibiotics and oral rehydration solution.
He presents with severe abdominal pain and vomiting. CT scan reveals appendicitis. Urgent surgery scheduled for appendectomy.
She complains of weight gain and hair loss. Blood tests indicate hypothyroidism. Started on levothyroxine. Follow-up thyroid function tests scheduled.
He has been experiencing memory loss and confusion. MRI shows cortical atrophy. Diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. Started on cognitive enhancers.
She presents with joint swelling and stiffness, worse in the mornings. Diagnosed with osteoarthritis. Prescribed pain relievers and joint injections.
He complains of chronic dry cough and fatigue. Lung function tests indicate restrictive lung disease. Referred to a pulmonologist for further evaluation.
She reports frequent urination and pain during urination. Urinalysis shows urinary tract infection. Prescribed antibiotics and advised to drink plenty of fluids.
He presents with sudden severe chest pain. ECG shows ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI). Urgent cardiac catheterization performed for coronary angioplasty.
She complains of abdominal bloating and constipation. Colonoscopy reveals diverticulosis. Recommended high-fiber diet and regular bowel habits.
He reports sudden onset of severe headache and nausea. CT scan shows subarachnoid hemorrhage. Emergency neurosurgical consultation arranged.
She presents with swelling and pain in the ankles. Diagnosed with gout. Prescribed colchicine and advised on dietary changes to reduce purine intake.
He complains of frequent headaches and sensitivity to light. Diagnosed with migraines. Prescribed triptans for acute attacks and preventive medications.
She reports persistent cough with yellow-green sputum. Chest X-ray shows pneumonia. Prescribed antibiotics and advised on respiratory hygiene.
He presents with abdominal pain and diarrhea after meals. Suspected lactose intolerance. Recommended lactose-free diet and symptom monitoring.
She complains of vision loss and seeing flashes of light. Eye examination reveals retinal detachment. Urgent referral to an ophthalmologist for surgery.
He reports sudden onset of weakness and slurred speech. MRI shows ischemic stroke. Urgent treatment with thrombolytic therapy initiated.
She presents with chronic joint pain and swelling, affecting multiple joints. Diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). Referred to a rheumatologist.
He complains of chronic fatigue and unexplained weight loss. Blood tests reveal HIV infection. Started on antiretroviral therapy and referred to an infectious disease specialist.
She reports burning sensation and pain during urination. Urinalysis shows kidney stones. Prescribed pain medication and advised on dietary changes to prevent recurrence.
He presents with severe abdominal pain and distension. CT scan shows bowel obstruction. Emergency surgery scheduled for bowel resection.
She complains of recurrent episodes of severe abdominal pain and diarrhea. Colonoscopy reveals ulcerative colitis. Prescribed corticosteroids and immunosuppressants.
He reports episodes of blurred vision and seeing halos around lights. Diagnosed with acute angle-closure glaucoma. Urgent treatment to lower intraocular pressure initiated.
She presents with sudden onset of chest pain and shortness of breath. ECG shows atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. Started on rate-control medications.
He complains of persistent lower abdominal pain and changes in bowel habits. Colonoscopy shows colon polyps. Scheduled for polypectomy and surveillance.
She reports difficulty swallowing and regurgitation of food. Upper endoscopy reveals esophageal stricture. Scheduled for dilatation procedure.
He presents with severe pain and swelling in the big toe. Diagnosed with acute gout attack. Prescribed nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and advised on lifestyle changes.
She complains of recurrent sore throat and enlarged lymph nodes. Throat culture confirms streptococcal pharyngitis. Prescribed antibiotics and advised on symptom management.
He reports persistent joint pain and morning stiffness. Blood tests show elevated rheumatoid factor and anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) antibodies. Diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis.
She presents with sudden onset of severe chest pain radiating to the back. CT angiography shows aortic dissection. Urgent cardiothoracic surgical consultation arranged.
